intro: Psychotria kaoensis, commonly known as the Kaoensis Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
